Class CommandAck

java.lang.Object
edu.io.net.command.Command
edu.io.net.command.CommandAck
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class CommandAck extends Command
Represents an acknowledgement command sent in response to the reception of another Command.

A CommandAck confirms that a specific command was received and optionally includes a response command that may contain the result of its processing.

This class is immutable and extends Command, reusing the identifier of the acknowledged request. This allows the sender to correlate acknowledgements with their original commands.

The request command is marked as transient since it is typically used only in local application logic and is not meant to be serialized over the network.

See Also:

  • Field Details

    • NO_ACK

      public static final CommandAck NO_ACK
      A special CommandAck instance representing the absence of a meaningful acknowledgement.

      NO_ACK can be returned when a command is unknown, unsupported, or when no response should be sent to the client. This avoids sending null or throwing exceptions while still fulfilling the contract of returning a CommandAck.

      Since NO_ACK is immutable and shared, it can be safely reused across the server without creating new objects.

  • Constructor Details

    • CommandAck

      public CommandAck(@NotNull @NotNull Command reqCmd)
      Constructs a new acknowledgement for the specified request command without an associated response.

      Equivalent to calling: 

      
 new CommandAck(reqCmd, Command.NO_CMD);
      Parameters:
      reqCmd - command being acknowledged
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if reqCmd is null

    • CommandAck

      public CommandAck(@NotNull @NotNull Command reqCmd, @NotNull @NotNull CommandRe resCmd)
      Constructs a new acknowledgement for the specified request and response commands.

      The acknowledgement inherits the identifier of the request command, allowing correlation between them.

      Parameters:
      reqCmd - command being acknowledged
      resCmd - response command associated with the acknowledgement
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if either argument is null

  • Method Details

    • reqCmd

      public Command reqCmd()
      Returns the original command that this acknowledgement refers to.
      Returns:
      acknowledged request command

    • resCmd

      public CommandRe resCmd()
      Returns the response command associated with this acknowledgement.

      May be a placeholder command (e.g. Command.NO_CMD) if no response is available.

      Returns:
      associated response command
